text: Robert McCormick Adams Jr. (July 23, 1926 â€“ January 27, 2018) was an American anthropologist and archaeologist. He was Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution from 1984 to 1994. He has worked in both the Near East and Mesoamerica. He was best known for his research in Iraq. Adams, Jr. died on January 27, 2018 in Chula Vista, California at the age of 91. == References == Category:1926 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Educators from Chicago Category:American anthropologists Category:American archaeologists Category:Scientists from Chicago
title: Robert McCormick Adams Jr.
